front.title: Using the SRP protocol as a key exchange method in Secure Shell

abstract.t: This memo describes an experimental method for authentication andkeyexchange in the Secure Shell protocol.The main virtue of the SRP protocol [SRP] is that it providesauthentication based on a small secret (typically a password). It isuseful in situations where no authentic host key is known. For SecureShell, it can be used as a bootstrapping procedure to get the hostkey of a server in a safe way. SRP also provides authentication ofthe user, which means that it might make sense to either skip thesecsh 'ssh-userauth'-service [SSH-USERAUTH] when using SRP, or allowlogin with the 'none' or 'external-keyx' method.
